item.title: Moving to Gatsby
item.content:encoded:
Since I am more comfortable writing in Javascript that in Ruby I decided to move from Jekyll to Gatbsy for my personal blogging.

I was kind overwhelmed by broken Ruby Gems and weired dependency errors from time to time, so I took the decision for the move. Of course I had to put some effort migrating and leaving behind my favorite theme Minimal Mistakes in favor of Lumen. With small customizations to adjust some parts I really loved from the previous theme, in the end I came up with something very similar :P… The process was really straightforward and in the meantime I had some introduction to React and GraphQL since I have an Angular background. Playing with React was easier than I thought!.

I am going to miss some great features of Jekyll and Ruby but I think I can bear with it.

item.title: Hello Jekyll
item.content:encoded:
Hello Jekyll, Hello World! Decided to give up Wordpress for personal blogging for good giving Jekyll a try here in Github Pages.

As far as now I can tell:

  • Templating with Liquid is nice
  • Easy setup in Github Pages
  • By nature it’s a static generator, no more security worries for the paranoid O_O …

Happy Jekyll blogging!
